uttarapāla： uttarapāla（pu）
ဥတ္တရပါလ（ပု）
«uttara+pāla+a»
[ဥတ္တရ+ပါလ+အ]

Uttarapāla：A thera．He was the son of a brahmin in Sāvatthi．When he had attained to years of discretion he saw the Twin Miracle and entered the Order．One day，amid desultory recollection，he was beset by sensual desires，but after a violent mental struggle，he arrested his evil thoughts and attained arahantship．



In the time of Vipassī Buddha，he had made a bridge for the Buddha to cross （Thag．252-4； ThagA．i．371f）．

He is evidently identical with Setudāyaka of the Apadāna （ii．408）．

uttarapāla：ဥတ္တရပါလ（ပု）
[ဥတ္တရ+ပါလ+အ]
ဥတ္တရပါလမည်သော၊ သူ။
